laboratory_examinations.findings: Identified a heterozygous c.1444_1449delATGCTG deletion in exon 8 of NPR2, predicted to lead to deletion of two amino acids Met482 -Leu483 within the sub-membrane region of NPR-B.
Basal cGMP levels and CNP-stimulated cGMP production were markedly increased in the proband's skin fibroblasts compared to controls.
The mutant NPR-B showed augmented baseline and CNP-stimulated guanylyl cyclase activity compared to wild-type NPR-B.
The growth curve of the eldest daughter showed progressive growth acceleration until the age of 4.5 years up to a height of +2 SDS.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The growth of the two daughters is not as pronounced compared to the proband.
